messages: d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (10:32): delewis: No, dude, the Ultra 5 is sooo slower than the Ultra 10.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:38): LeftWing: you missed an #mplayerdev classic argument earlier.
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (10:39): delewis: Probably a good thing, I don't think I have the stamina for it today. =P
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:39): I'll sum it up for you: Linux has technical reasons for not having a stable API. Any other operating system that does not have a stable API has stagnated.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:40): and yes, that is a 100% accurate paraphrasing.

d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (10:40): delewis: Please, puh-lease tell me that this argument didn't come from the same person who I distinctly remember telling me that OS development is over and that all OSes are feature-complete.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:40): LeftWing: no, actually, he stayed out of it most of the time.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:41): though, he did say that one of the "good things" about Linux is that its not chained to any one, specific implementation of anything.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:41): (positively, speaking)
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (10:41): It's chained to one specific implementation of ALSA. =P

d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (10:43): Someone should explain to them the principle of "Measure Twice, Cut Once."  You shouldn't need to keep changing an API, purely because you didn't think about it clearly enough the first time around.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:44): http://riemann.solnetworks.net/~dlewis/mplayerdevfunny.txt.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:45): http://riemann.solnetworks.net/~dlewis/mplayerdevfunny.txt
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:45): trust me, its worth the read.

d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (10:51): Perhaps it's a sound technical decision for an alpha-grade product that isn't yet released, but it certainly isn't one from the point of view of the poor sods that have to use and develop for the system.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:52): LeftWing: you're forgetting that the majority of people in that channel don't use Linux for anything meaningful (well, they would disagree).

d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (10:52): Oh, and the other thing that irks me is the argument that discouraging proprietary drivers in this way will eventually cause companies like nvidia to cave and release opensource drivers.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:52): they don't understand that when you roll an operating system out into the "real world", there is no second chance to learn from.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:52): you do it right the first time around or you fuck up, like Microshit.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:53): LeftWing: yes, when the *real* solution is for Linux to maintain a stable API.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:53): of course Nvidia isn't going to protest.

d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (10:55): One day they'll realise that consumers want drivers from manufacturers of cards to be embraced.  Or, alternately, they'll remain in many respects a hobbyist technical utopia.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:55): they also are unable to distinguish "free" from "proprietary"
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:55): "proprietary" only entails open specifications.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:55): they don't want that.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:56): they want *source*
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:56): even if Nvidia did provide specifications and at the same time, provided a binary-only driver, they still wouldn't be satisifed.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:57): regardless
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (10:57): reading that log the second time around gave me a chuckle. :-)

d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (10:58): Actually I think if specs were provided, they'd just latch on permanently to whatever the open-source driver writers came up with as a result, and trumpet (regardless of reality) the fact that it was a superior driver.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:00): computers and politicks shouldn't be allowed to mix, you know. :-)
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:00): and that's what this is.
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:00): It's computers and religion.
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:01): It's like the ksh93 flame-fest I've been reading on osol-discuss.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:01): no one really cares about systems development anymore
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:01): if they did, licensing concerns wouldn't bother anyone from using a particular system.
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:01): Sensibilities go out the window in favour of calling people a heretic.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:01): take Plan 9 for instance.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:02): very interesting operating system, but do any of the Linux people (who are supposedly proclaimed computer scientists) care about it? no.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:02): why? it had a "shady" past of being guarded by Bell Labs.
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:02): Support from vendors and a client base is somewhat important, too. ;P
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:02): despite *any* "interesting" features it may have.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:02): it's all have the license
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:02): and thus all about religion.
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:03): Anyway I have to go to the library.

74287088e072d7bf252ce205150cecd0 (11:27): delewis: I like the guy complaining about the 3-4 different USB APIs for windows.  Later someone pastes the url for kroah's keynote speech, since he's the guy the wrote the api_nonsense doc, where it says the linux USB stack has been rewritten at least 3 times.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:28): IvanR_: exactly, but they're against backwards compatibility. "If it sucks, dump it".
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:29): so, rewriting an API 3 times isn't a big deal because its "quality control", on the other hand maintaining 3 APIs for the sake of compatibility is bad.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (11:31): and of course, "any OS with a stable API is stagnant".

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (11:45): is there any part of linux that hasn't been rewritten at least 2 times? hell someparts are rewritten every year, and everytime the '''LKML" flow complaints that this is worst piece of crap i have ever seen..
